events.originalText: Arab Spring: Bahraini security forces killed four protesters in a pre-dawn raid at the Pearl Roundabout in Manama, while the "Day of Rage" took place in Libya with nationwide protests against Muammar Gaddafi's government.
events.subtitle: Arab Spring
events.headline: Bahraini security forces kill four protesters in Manama raid

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Provisional Irish Republican Army carried out a bombing of a restaurant near Belfast, Northern Ireland, killing twelve people and injuring thirty others.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: IRA bombing kills twelve in Belfast restaurant

events.originalText: A U.S. Army soldier stole a Bell UH-1 helicopter (pictured) and landed it on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, D.C.
events.subtitle: Bell UH-1 Iroquois
events.headline: US Army soldier steals helicopter, lands on White House lawn

events.originalText: Gabonese military officers overthrew President Léon M'ba, but French forces, honouring a 1960 treaty, forcibly reinstated him two days later.
events.subtitle: 1964 Gabonese coup d'état
events.headline: Gabonese military officers overthrow President M'ba

events.originalText: Vanguard 2 (model pictured), the first weather satellite, was launched to measure cloud cover distribution.
events.subtitle: Vanguard 2
events.headline: First weather satellite Vanguard 2 launched

events.originalText: World War II: The U.S. Navy began Operation Hailstone, a massive naval air and surface attack against the Japanese naval and air base at Chuuk Lagoon in the Caroline Islands.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US Navy begins Operation Hailstone against Japanese base

events.originalText: The Armory Show, the first large modern-art exhibition in the United States, opened at the 69th Regiment Armory in New York City.
events.subtitle: Armory Show
events.headline: Armory Show opens in New York City

events.originalText: Italian composer Giacomo Puccini's Madama Butterfly  premiered at La Scala in Milan to poor reviews, forcing him to revise the opera.
events.subtitle: Giacomo Puccini
events.headline: Puccini's Madama Butterfly premieres at La Scala

events.originalText: Rudolf Diesel's first working diesel engine ran for one minute.
events.subtitle: Rudolf Diesel
events.headline: Rudolf Diesel's first engine runs for one minute

events.originalText: Cochinchina campaign: French Navy forces captured the Citadel of Saigon, defended by 1,000 Vietnamese soldiers of the Nguyễn dynasty.
events.subtitle: Cochinchina campaign
events.headline: French Navy captures Citadel of Saigon in Cochinchina campaign

events.originalText: Zulu impis massacred about 532 Voortrekkers, Khoekhoe, and Basuto near present-day Weenen, South Africa.
events.subtitle: Impi
events.headline: Zulu impis massacre hundreds in South Africa

events.originalText: The United States ratifies the Treaty of Ghent – signed in late 1814 – formally ending the War of 1812.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Ghent
events.headline: US ratifies Treaty of Ghent, ending War of 1812

events.originalText: Myles Standish was elected the first commander of the militia of Plymouth Colony.
events.subtitle: Myles Standish
events.headline: Myles Standish elected first commander of Plymouth Colony militia
